description: The image depicts a statue of a male figure standing upright. The figure is nearly nude, wearing only a small piece of cloth around his lower body. He has a muscular build, with well-defined arms and legs. His right arm is extended outward with his hand raised, while his left arm is bent at the elbow, holding what appears to be a draped cloth or garment over his shoulder. The figure's head is bald, and he wears sandals on his feet. The statue is mounted on a circular base. The style of the statue, including the realistic depiction of the human form and the use of classical drapery, suggests it belongs to a period known for its advanced sculptural techniques and attention to anatomical detail. The overall appearance and pose of the figure are characteristic of works from the Imperial Roman period.
